stream_context.summary: Kaze prototypes Course 11’s ‘Bowser construction-site’ star.  He tests the room on real N64, fixes an N64-only crash, builds a domino-style Womp tower, integrates Koopa worker animations, writes in-game dialogue, tweaks lighting and begins ROM-size/audio optimisation.

development_findings.summary: Real-hardware test exposed a floating-point exception in the background-shaping routine; bug located to a colour-table load (`F2` undefined) and earmarked for quick fix.
development_findings.quote: There is a crash in this function here on N64 only … Something in this colour table is just not being read correctly.

development_findings.summary: AI-generated lo-fi tracks used as temporary music; final OST being written by Badub.
development_findings.quote: The OST for this is literally AI-generated lo-fi and I think it fits really well.

development_findings.summary: ROM-size pass begun: all SM64 stock backgrounds removed and 44 kHz samples will be down-sampled, saving roughly half a megabyte for streamed WAV audio in large areas.
development_findings.quote: We’re at a point where we have to optimise the game for ROM size … we’re gonna save like half a megabyte of ROM size.

development_findings.summary: First star revolves around sabotaging five Bowser workers (cement Koopa, lunch-break Goomba, glass-carrying Koopas, oil-barrel slide, stacked Womp tower). Workers wear Bowser helmets and are deliberately rude to Mario to entice player interference.
development_findings.quote: Back off, pipsqueak! No cutting the line – it’s almost my turn to be made into a building.

development_findings.summary: Implemented Womp-tower object: 10 Womps stacked brick-style; kicking one triggers chain-reaction fall with custom particle dust, sound layering and animation offsets.
development_findings.quote: I like the VFX here.  The animation works well – it feels like real dominoes.

development_findings.summary: New lighting model: camera now acts as light source plus global brightness slider to avoid overly dark levels.
development_findings.quote: Video-game graphics are all about faking everything – nothing we do is how light works in real life.

development_findings.summary: Layout revision: large crane platform shortened/moved to improve performance; considering deleting unused buffer area.
development_findings.quote: This whole platform has no purpose other than to extend some platforming … this is a prime candidate for just cutting it.

development_findings.summary: Multiplayer under consideration (Mario, Luigi, maybe Yoshi) but dialogue replacements and rideable-Yoshi complications not yet solved.
development_findings.quote: If we have Yoshi as a character, having a rideable Yoshi?  That would be fucked up.

development_findings.summary: Release goal set to the 30th (aligned with an unnamed competition).
development_findings.quote: I’m planning to release it on the 30th, which I think is the deadline for someone’s competition.

context_findings.summary: Design philosophy: difficulty is secondary to ‘cool platforming’; multiple small hints preferred over explicit markers (‘show, don’t tell’).
context_findings.quote: You can never truly get everyone to 100 % success; instead you layer lots of small fail-safes so each player catches one of them.

context_findings.summary: Kaze shifted streams from Twitch to YouTube due to excessive ads and prefers single-platform VOD management.
context_findings.quote: I couldn’t stand Twitch anymore because of all the ads.

context_findings.summary: Personal environment: local thunderstorms caused flooding the night before the stream.
context_findings.quote: We actually had a lot of flooding yesterday.

context_findings.summary: Self-confidence in technical expertise: claims to know more about N64 than Nintendo.
context_findings.quote: I definitely know a lot more about the N64 than Nintendo ever did.

badub.summary: Returned after hiatus; has spent a week and ten drafts on a level track and is ‘really putting in the effort’.
badub.quote: Badub finally wrote me again today … he’s been working on it for a week and said ten different tries and he just can’t figure out how to make it good – but he’s really putting in the effort.

zeina.summary: Creates Womp and Koopa worker animations (idle, angled falls, anger, talking); iterates eye expressions and frame counts per Kaze’s feedback.
zeina.quote: Zeina, you can do those already if you want – just send them over with a list of animations you want.

zeina.summary: Jointly evaluates level layout and renders; collaborates via Discord during stream.

key_stories.title: Domino Womp Tower
key_stories.summary: Chat suggests turning Womps into building bricks.  Kaze builds a 10-Womp tower; Zeina supplies angled fall animations; Kaze adds particles and sound layers until the collapse feels comedic and performant.
key_stories.challenge: Create a memorable set-piece for worker sabotage star.
key_stories.process: Stacked Womps, added chain-reaction logic, optimised triangles, tuned particle dust and sound playback.
key_stories.outcome: Working domino tower that triggers star progress and showcases new particle system.
key_stories.key_quote: This level is so funny – between all the comedic things and the animations.

key_stories.title: Badub’s Comeback
key_stories.summary: Composer Badub returns after silence, experimenting with ten versions of a track for Course 11.
key_stories.challenge: Need bespoke music instead of placeholder AI lo-fi.
key_stories.process: Badub iterates for a week; Kaze offers encouragement and public praise.
key_stories.outcome: Track not yet delivered but momentum restored.
key_stories.key_quote: He’s back and he’s making music again.

key_stories.title: N64-Only Crash Hunt
key_stories.summary: Real-hardware test crashes in background-shaping code.
key_stories.challenge: Floating-point exception loading `F2` from colour table on N64.
key_stories.process: Kaze disassembles, traces registers, and decides to patch offset handling.
key_stories.outcome: Bug located; quick fix planned before next cartridge test.
key_stories.key_quote: Should be pretty easy to fix – I can actually just find the exact line of code.
